Articles.Content:
Ok, so I was in my Mun station that was made for finding easter eggs.

When I saw this...

I know that is an arch, I am familiar with it. But whats that other sparkling dot? Could it be a monolith?

Thanks.
Judging by the location, I think that might be the Neil Armstrong Memorial.
Nah, this is an an entirely different crater. Thanks for the thought though.

The Neil Armstrong monument is in the crater west of the crater with the arch. The monument is on the crater's south.

We are explorers. Why don't we explore this spot of land? ;-)

By any chance does it's position stay the same or does it move?

And I'm pretty sure that's not the Armstrong memorial if that arch is on the North side of the crater.
Pretty sure it's the Armstrong Memorial. The memorial has an arch to the NW of it just outside of the crater it is located in. Turning the picture, and it lines up.

Pretty sure it's the Armstrong Memorial. The memorial has an arch to the NW of it just outside of the crater it is located in. Turning the picture, and it lines up.

no, that's another crater. this one is the one with a small hill inside, which you can kinda see on the left.

The monoliths aren't visible unless you get close to them at any rate. I saw a similar thing to this before the forum crash a while ago, where an arch on the other side of the Mun was visible through the terrain.

Ok, people, this is a different crater.

The one the Neil Armstrong memorial is in is THIS one

This is the place I am talking about

So it is NOT the Neil Armstrong memorial.
land and look
Time for a quick rover ride.
Its probably just a random pixel... Last I checked there was no easter egg there.

Inside a Secret Room on Kerbin

"Sighting Analomy QW12 has been reported many times by astronauts working in the area. Since then, there have been power and electrical disruptions to the craft in it's range, and it has caused the failure of the Munar Dust mission. We will be dispatching a probe shortly. Any questions?"

"Um, excuse me sir, but what where you saying again?"

Its probably just a random pixel... Last I checked there was no easter egg there.

If you saw it, you'd know it was an easter egg or something.

It was flashing and extremely vivid.
so, did you land and check what that thing is?

Not yet, I'm at a loss for ideas.

I should hurry up huh.
Can you see it every time you orbit above that spot?
My Mun space station happened to be passing over that crater, so I took a few pics, I could only see the Mun Arch. http://imgur.com/a/QP7GB

Well, I landed there and I found... NOTHING.

I swear, I've seen this almost every time I orbit over that spot. I didn't do a through investigation though. But I swear, it looked just like an easter egg.

I think this calls for.. DUH NU NU!! A through investigation. Which means we need to explore that spot. First one to find something gets a cookie!
interesting... very interesting...

Well, I landed there and I found... NOTHING.

I swear, I've seen this almost every time I orbit over that spot. I didn't do a through investigation though. But I swear, it looked just like an easter egg.

I think this calls for.. DUH NU NU!! A through investigation. Which means we need to explore that spot. First one to find something gets a cookie!

You arent insane, I saw the twinkle too Landed as well, found nothing! Doesnt make any sense I say... no bloody sense at all. Ill get a Mapsat satellite orbiting the Mun and turn anomolies on, Ill tell you if it says theres an anomaly there
Its probably just a graphical bug with the terrain.

Its probably just a graphical bug with the terrain.

But I saw it tooo and it isnt a normal graphical terrain bug like when you see the whole Mun twinkling in the cracks of the textures.. Its the beacon like shining of arches and easter eggs!
So I'm not crazy!

But I saw it tooo and it isnt a normal graphical terrain bug like when you see the whole Mun twinkling in the cracks of the textures.. Its the beacon like shining of arches and easter eggs!

There are probably areas with the terrain where graphical bugs could happen all the time.
